rich_narrative.summary: The Hassan Foundation is a dedicated humanitarian organization focused on improving health and human development in Pakistan through sustainable infrastructure and educational support. Founded in <cite id="1">2007</cite>, the organization primarily addresses the critical need for potable water and basic education in impoverished regions. Its core mission is to <cite id="2">promote human development by preserving life</cite> through direct service delivery. The foundation's operations are characterized by a lean financial model, reporting <cite id="3">$586,737 in total revenue</cite> for the 2022 fiscal year. A significant portion of its work involves <cite id="4">clean water projects, orphan support, and disaster relief</cite>, targeting the most vulnerable populations in Pakistan. Despite its relatively small scale, the foundation maintains a high <cite id="5">program expense ratio of 88.2%</cite>, ensuring that the vast majority of donor contributions are utilized for direct field activities rather than administrative overhead. The organization also facilitates religious giving by maintaining <cite id="6">zakat-eligible programs</cite> that serve the poor (fuqara) and needy (masakin).
